result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Minter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam J Minter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam J Minter was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - DEEFENDANT TERMINATED FROM BMP
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.   
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence against Timothy M. or Amy M.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.

- Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.

Final pre-trial on May 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.   
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence against Timothy M. or Amy M.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $750.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Trial Court Br 7

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
